item.title: An Intro to Unix File Permissions
item.description: Unix file permissions can be strange and confusing. This is a basic introduction and cheat sheet. ls -l file.txt shows you file.txt’s permissions, among other things: -rw-r--r-- 1 mike staff 0 Nov 1 20:09 file.txt But what does this stuff mean? The file name – file.txt – is reported on the far right. To its left, ls reports the date and time when file.txt was last modified: Nov 1 20:09. To the left of this, file.
